item.title: Widgets in action
item.description: Two additional widgets are now available for use in GTK applications: An extended filedialog, inspired by Windows UI design and much more powerful than the built-in one; and, an easy-to-use Messagebox wrapper. See them in action!

item.title: If it's not tested, it's broken
item.description: Inspired by JUnit, the XP framework features unit testing.

item.title: New collection: RMI [alpha]
item.description:
RMI stands for "Remote Method Invokation". See the api doc of rmi.RMIObject for an example
Note: Since this is still alpha, the API might still change.

item.title: Multi-Tasking with XP: Threads
item.description:
Using the lang.Thread class, you can write multi-tasked applications. See the API documentation for an example.
Note: This feature is only available on UNIX platforms as it makes use of the fork() function

item.title: New collection: peer.server
item.description: The classes in peer.server allow you to write standalone TCP/IP servers

item.title: New collection: org.imc
item.description: Personal Data Interchange (PDI) occurs every time two or more individuals communicate, in either a business or personal context, face-to-face, or across space and time. Such interchanges frequently include the exchange of informal information, such as business cards, telephone numbers, addresses, dates, and times of appointments. Augmenting PDI with electronics and telecommunications can help ensure that information is quickly and reliably communicated, stored, organized and easily located when needed. The versit consortium developed a comprehensive family of PDI technologies based on open specifications and interoperability agreements to help meet this technology need and that will allow you to communicate more easily, faster and more accurately. The two main technologies that came from the versit consortium were vCard, an electronic business card, and vCalendar, an electronic calendaring and scheduling exchange format.

item.title: New collection: text
item.description: The collection util.text was moved to top-level

item.title: Graph API added
item.description: The graphic API will add powerful options to imaging: Piecharts, diagrams, ...

item.title: NetClassLoader finalized
item.description: The ability to load classes via HTTP or HTTPS allows, for example, software to update it self.

item.title: CSVParser class added
item.description: CSVParser provides comfortable way to parse csv (comma separated value) - files.

item.title: MySQL Adapter completed
item.description: Reverse engineer MySQL - tables, databases, attributes and keys. This functionality allows for automatic creation of database classes from MySQL.

item.title: About XP
item.description: An introduction to the XP framework, including installation tips, coding standards, a howto on class documentation and CVS guidelines is now available. Enjoy reading!

item.title: [Beta] Added collection org.webdav
item.description: A first version now allows clients to browse a webdav directory

item.title: Added collection util.text.format
item.description: Formatting strings has become even easier. Have a look at the MessageFormat class for examples

item.title: [Beta] Telephony API
item.description: With providing an API to telephony applications, another very interesting feature has been introduced

item.title: XP goes "multimedia"
item.description: Initial support for MP3 files was added

item.title: Added class org.cvshome.CVSInterface
item.description: Description: This class is an easy to use interface to the concurrent versioning system executables

item.title: API Docs released
item.description: An initial release of the XP api docs has been created. There is still some missing functionality but the documentation is already quite usable.

item.title: Website created
item.description: The first version of the XP web site is online
